title: Wolves spoil Jokic's 61-point triple-double in 2OT
content: The Timberwolves overcame a career- and NBA-best 61-point triple-double performance from Nikola Jokic to outlast the Nuggets 140-139 in double overtime on Tuesday night.

title: Curry drops 52 in wild win vs. Grizz: 'Tank is full'
content: Stephen Curry had 52 points and 12 3-pointers as the Warriors held on for a wild 134-125 win over the Grizzlies on Tuesday night.

title: Ovechkin nets No. 891, four shy of NHL history
content: Washington captain Alex Ovechkin scored his 891st career goal, moving him four away from passing Wayne Gretzky's NHL record, and Dylan Strome broke a third-period tie Tuesday night to lead the first-place Capitals to a 4-3 victory over the Boston Bruins.

title: Bucks catch fire, shoot highest FG% this century
content: The Bucks snapped a four-game skid by shooting 68.9% from the field Tuesday night against the Suns, the highest single-game percentage by any team this century.

title: Campbell reunites with Cards for 18th NFL season
content: Six-time Pro-Bowl defensive lineman Calais Campbell has finalized a one-year deal to return to the Arizona Cardinals for his 18th NFL season, the team announced.

title: Stanton won't blame ailing elbows on torpedo bats
content: Yankees slugger Giancarlo Stanton declined Tuesday to say whether he believes using the torpedo bats last season caused the elbow ailments that have sidelined him this season.

title: Roy: Duclair 'god-awful' during Isles' 4-1 loss
content: In the heat of the Eastern Conference playoff race, and with his team struggling, New York Islanders coach Patrick Roy said Anthony Duclair was "god-awful" in a loss to the Tampa Bay Lightning, and that the veteran is failing to meet expectations.

title: Dodgers' 7-0 start ties 1933 Yanks as May returns
content: With Dustin May on the mound for the first time in more than 22 months, the Dodgers came from behind to beat the Braves 3-1 on Tuesday night and improve to 7-0, tying the 1933 Yankees for the best start to a season by a reigning World Series champion.

title: Everything we heard at NFL league meetings: QB options, draft maneuvers, roster holes
content: Annual NFL owners meetings wrapped up Tuesday, and more than 20 of our reporters on the ground had all the buzz from Palm Beach.

title: What's going on with Rafael Devers? Putting his historic strikeout streak into context
content: Boston's designated hitter has struck out 15 times and has no hits through the first five games. Here's what history tells us about his bad start.

title: Pain Index: Where do Arkansas, Purdue, other second-weekend losses rank?
content: Some losses are understandable; others will haunt us forever. Let's rank the 2025 men's NCAA tournament defeats, from least to most devastating.

title: Two weeks left in the NBA season! Answering the biggest questions
content: Our NBA insiders break down six things to keep your eye on in the last two weeks of the NBA regular season.

title: NBA play-in tournament 2025: Schedule, standings, format
content: Everything you need to know about the play-in tournament, including how it works, who's playing and when.

title: Inside the Grizzlies' shocking firing of Taylor Jenkins
content: The Grizzlies believe this firing will help reconnect the team's tantalizing core -- and reignite Ja Morant. But in truth, this dismissal began with five other ones nearly a year ago.

title: Bukayo Saka's return provides a glimmer of hope in Arsenal's injury-riddled season
content: Bukayo Saka made his return for Arsenal after three months, making an instant impact and giving Mikel Arteta's Gunners hope for what lies ahead.

title: Anthony Elanga is proof of how Man United desperately need to improve transfer strategy
content: Man United have seen more players leave and find success than those still at the club now. That must change.

title: 'The whole thing is chaos': The art of the March Madness buzzer-beater
content: How does a buzzer-beater come to be? A little strategy, a lot of luck, and the right player at the right time.

title: Women's Final Four predictions: A unanimous favorite and a split decision
content: No. 1 seeds UCLA, South Carolina and Texas are bound for Tampa, as well as 2-seed UConn. Who will reach the title game?

title: Reranking the women's Final Four: First look at the national semifinals
content: No. 1 seeds UCLA, South Carolina and Texas advanced to the Final Four. But 2-seed UConn tops our list.

title: An MIT-educated professor, the New York Yankees and the bat that could be changing baseball
content: After the Yankees' home run barrage with bats that look like bowling pins, the innovation is sweeping baseball.

title: Amorim: I won't get much time to fix Utd woes
content: Ruben Amorim insisted he will not be given much time to turn things around as Manchester United manager, as his team slumped to another defeat at Nottingham Forest on Tuesday.

title: Arteta 'worried' by Arsenal's fresh injury crisis
content: Arsenal face a potential injury crisis in defense ahead of their Champions League showdown with Real Madrid after Gabriel Magalhães and Jurriën Timber picked up injuries in Tuesday's Premier League win over Fulham.

title: Messi fit as Miami eyes 'big step' into semifinals
content: Inter Miami head coach Javier Mascherano recognized the importance of reaching the Concacaf Champions Cup semifinals as a young club, but warned against taking the quarterfinal series against LAFC for granted.

title: Carlo: Madrid made final despite 'a lot of mistakes'
content: Carlo Ancelotti admitted Real Madrid made "a lot of mistakes" but also did "a lot of good things" in a 4-4 draw with Real Sociedad on Tuesday, which saw them reach the Copa del Rey final 5-4 on aggregate.

title: St. Pauli fans pay $29M for majority of club stadium
content: St. Pauli supporters have raised over 27 million euros (29.1 million) for a majority stake in the club's stadium after taking part in German soccer's first fan cooperative.

title: Messi's bodyguard no longer on Miami sidelines
content: Lionel Messi's bodyguard Yassine Cheuko said he has been banned from protecting the Argentina forward from the touchline during Inter Miami matches.

title: Kane downplays PL return: 'Happy' at Bayern
content: In an exclusive interview with ESPN, Harry Kane said he is unsure about a Premier League return and said he is already playing at the highest level.

title: 3rd-tier Bielefeld dump champs Bayer from cup
content: Third-tier Arminia Bielefeld stunned holders Bayer Leverkusen 2-1 on Tuesday, coming from a goal down to reach the German Cup final.

title: Vermes' Sporting KC exit marks end of a managerial era in MLS
content: Peter Vermes left Sporting KC, and as he goes, so too does the idea of a singular leader of a modern MLS club.

title: Players to watch at the 2025 ANWA: Lottie Woad, Asterisk Talley among top contenders
content: Who are some of the top players to watch at the sixth edition of the Augusta National Women's Amateur.

title: Messi, Brady, Shaq turn out for Beckham's 50th birthday party in Miami
content: He doesn't turn 50 for another month, but David Beckham has already kicked off the celebrations for his half-century by throwing a party in Miami.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man Utd eye £40m move for Liam Delap
content: Is Ipswich's Liam Delap the one to solve Manchester United's goal-scoring woes? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Letting Salah leave for free could be one of Liverpool's biggest mistakes ever
content: As Mo Salah eyes Erling Haaland's record, Liverpool's failure to get him a new contract looks reckless.

title: Can growth-minded IndyCar afford to return to Thermal?
content: The Thermal Club was a luxurious oasis for IndyCar, but is visiting a hyper-exclusive venue good for business?

title: Adrian Peterson, Antonio Gates take center stage in Madden NFL 25 Season 7
content: Another wave of Madden Ultimate Team content has been revealed, with Franchise Heroes coming to the roster.

title: MNS targets Maharashtra govt over flyover delay with 'Kunal Kamra' banners
content: MNS criticized the Maharashtra govt for delays in constructing two flyovers on Kalyan Sheel Road, with prank banners featuring comedian Kunal Kamra. The project's slow pace since 2018 has caused major traffic jams. A political tussle ensued as local politicians from MNS and Shiv Sena traded barbs using the banners. Kamra faces FIR for remarks about Dy CM Shinde.

title: 15 FAQs to explain all you need to know on Waqf Bill
content: The central government plans to table the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2024 in Parliament, amidst opposition resistance. The bill seeks to improve the administration of Waqf properties, introduce technology-driven management, address legal complexities, and ensure transparency and accountability in Waqf management while incorporating key reforms.

title: Amazon CEO at Town Hall: 'Way to get ahead at Amazon is not to … '
content: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy emphasized that advancement at the company is based on achieving more with fewer resources, not building large teams. Jassy highlighted Amazon's commitment to agility and meritocracy, stressing customer impact and reducing bureaucracy as key factors in success. He urged employees to act quickly and innovate.

title: After pastor Bajinder Singh’s sentencing, rape survivor faints outside courtroom
content: Evangelical Christian pastor Bajinder Singh has been sentenced to life imprisonment for raping a woman in 2018. He was also fined Rs 1 lakh. The court announced the punishment after convicting him. Singh previously served time for a murder case. The woman expressed satisfaction with the verdict. Other accused persons were acquitted due to insufficient evidence.

title: Val Kilmer, iconic star of ‘Top Gun’ and ‘Batman Forever,’ passes away at 65
content: Val Kilmer, famous for his roles in 'Top Gun' and 'Batman Forever,' has died at 65. His daughter confirmed he died of pneumonia on April 1. Kilmer battled throat cancer for years. His major roles included Jim Morrison in 'The Doors' and Batman in 'Batman Forever.' He is survived by his two children, Mercedes and Jack.

title: Siddhivinayak's annual revenue rises to record Rs 133 crore
content: The Siddhivinayak temple trust in Prabhadevi reported record earnings of Rs 133 crore for the financial year 2024-25, a 15% increase from the previous year. Effective administration and efficient darshan arrangements contributed to the increase, with revenues from donations, prasad sales, and gold-silver offerings.

title: Ghibli AI images: 7 ChatGPT alternatives you can use to create free images
content: Studio Ghibli-inspired AI image creation has become a viral trend, allowing users to transform their photos into enchanting artworks with a dreamy, hand-drawn aesthetic. Various free tools, including Grok, Gemini 2.0, and Craiyon, enable users to generate these whimsical visuals effortlessly.

title: 6 financial changes from April 1 you should know
content: Starting April 1, 2025, changes in income tax slabs, UPI rules, and TDS thresholds will take effect. The highest tax rate of 30% applies to income above Rs 24 lakh. TDS thresholds for interest income have been increased. The Unified Pension Scheme begins and existing small savings scheme rates remain unchanged.

title: Pentecostal pastor Bajinder Singh to spend life in prison for rape
content: Evangelical Christian pastor Bajinder Singh was sentenced to life imprisonment and fined Rs 1 lakh by a special court in Mohali. Singh was convicted of raping a woman in 2018 and had previously served time for a murder conviction. He blackmailed the victim using a recording of the assault.

title: Cops force banker to cut short vacation to join Kamra probe
content: A 46-year-old banker from Navi Mumbai was forced to return from his holiday early due to calls from the police regarding his witness statement in a defamation case against comedian Kunal Kamra. The case involves Kamra's video that allegedly defamed Maharashtra's deputy CM, leading to an FIR.

title: The big Ghibli mistake everyone may be doing, warn security researchers
content: AI-generated Ghibli-style artwork has surged in popularity, with users transforming images using OpenAI's ChatGPT. However, Proton has raised concerns about privacy risks, stating that sharing personal photos with AI models can lead to loss of control over how those images are used, including potential misuse and data breaches.

title: How has Trump tariff threats on Russia impacted India’s purchases?
content: In March, Indian refiners increased US crude oil imports by 66% amidst US President Trump's push for American energy exports. Incidentally, Russian oil imports to India also rose due to suppliers circumventing US sanctions.

title: Right to shelter fundamental, pay Rs10L for each bulldozed home: SC
content: The Supreme Court of India mandated the Prayagraj Development Authority to compensate five homeowners, whose houses were unlawfully demolished in 2021, with Rs 10 lakh each. The court emphasized that the right to shelter is a fundamental right and must be protected under the rule of law.

title: Photos: Another Pant- Goenka post-match chat after PBKS thrash LSG
content: Punjab Kings won their second consecutive match in the IPL, defeating Lucknow Super Giants by eight wickets. PBKS captain Shreyas Iyer scored a match-winning fifty. LSG owner Sanjiv Goenka was seen conversing with Iyer and Rishabh Pant. Lucknow are still trying to adapt to their home conditions and will face Mumbai Indians next.

title: Former Nigerian boxing champion Gabriel Olanrewaju dies after collapsing during fight
content: Nigerian boxing champion Gabriel Olanrewaju tragically died after collapsing during a fight in Ghana. The 40-year-old lost consciousness in the third round and later died in the hospital, raising concerns over the bout's organization and approval.

title: Australian left stunned after doctor used ChatGPT for medical advice
content: A woman in Perth reported feeling shocked and disrespected when her doctor used ChatGPT to analyze her test results, calling it unprofessional. The incident has been reported to regulatory authorities, prompting debate over the use of AI tools in healthcare.

title: Pat McAfee, ESPN accused of spreading false scandal that ‘destroyed’ Ole Miss student
content: Mary Kate Cornett, an 18-year-old Ole Miss student, is taking legal action against ESPN's Pat McAfee for spreading false rumors about an affair, leading to harassment and ruining her life. The scandal originated on social media and was amplified by McAfee on his show, causing Cornett severe emotional distress and disrupting her college life.

title: No liquor sale in 19 holy cities of Madhya Pradesh, ban comes into effect
content: Devotees can no longer buy liquor in Ujjain for offerings at Kal Bhairav temple due to a new ban. Liquor sales within Ujjain municipal limits have ceased, closing all shops and bars. However, devotees can still carry legally purchased liquor from outside the city. The temple will maintain a two-day stock of liquor for rituals.

title: Soros-funded desi company also got Rs 8 crore from USAID: ED
content: The US Agency for International Development (USAID) is under scrutiny in an ongoing investigation related to hedge fund operator George Soros. ASAR Social Impact Advisors received Rs 8 crore from USAID as foreign inward remittance while also being funded by the Soros Economic Development Fund.

title: 'Turning art into crime': Kunal Kamra on summons to audience as he gets 3rd notice
content: Khar police have recorded statements from individuals present when comedian Kunal Kamra's show was recorded, following Shiv Sena's FIR against Kamra for his 'Naya Bharat' video. Kamra has received police notices for questioning, while the audience members are also being summoned. Kamra criticizes the targeting of artists and has interim relief from arrest until an April 7 hearing.

title: Why did wife of UP man who arranged her marriage with lover return in 4 days
content: In Sant Kabir Nagar, a man arranged his wife's marriage to her lover, fearing for his safety. However, four days later, the woman's new mother-in-law sent her back to the first husband, sympathizing with his struggle of raising their children alone.

title: Democratic US senator ends 25-hour anti-Trump speech, longest in history
content: Senator Cory Booker from New Jersey delivered a 25-hour and 4-minute speech in the Senate, breaking a record. He condemned the Trump administration's policies and emphasized the urgent threats they pose. Booker remained standing throughout, joined occasionally by other Democratic senators. His speech gained massive online attention and received praise for its endurance and dedication.

title: 'Top gun' fame actor Val Kilmer passes away at 65
content: Val Kilmer, renowned actor known for his roles in 'Top Gun' and 'Batman Forever,' passed away at the age of 65 due to pneumonia. Kilmer had battled throat cancer for years, but his contributions to Hollywood, including a memorable return in 'Top Gun: Maverick,' remain impactful.

title: Gujarat godown tragedy: Operator was held a year ago for IPL betting
content: A massive explosion at an illegal firecracker godown in Deesa, Banaskantha, killed 21 people, including four children, with most victims buried under debris. The accident, caused by unauthorized storage and manufacturing of firecrackers, led to the arrest of warehouse operators Khoobchand Thakkar and his son Deepak. Authorities are taking strict legal actions.

title: 5 dead in bus-SUV collision in Maharashtra's Buldhana
content: Five people lost their lives in a major accident involving an MSRTC bus, a Bolero SUV, and a private bus on the Khamgaon-Shegaon highway in Buldhana, Maharashtra. Rescue operations continue to free the trapped private bus driver, while police investigate the cause and assess further casualties.

title: Check heart health & find underlying diseases with this math calculation
content: Researchers suggest that dividing the average daily heart rate by the number of daily steps from wearables can offer insights into heart health. This Daily Heart Rate Per Step metric correlates with conditions like diabetes, hypertension, and heart failure. This approach could turn smartwatches into valuable tools for early detection of cardiovascular diseases.

title: Uttarakhand Waqf Board chairman says those opposing bill are 'political Muslims'
content: Uttarakhand Waqf Board chairman Shadab Shams criticized the opposition for opposing the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2024. He emphasized that PM Modi aims to mainstream poor Muslims and accused the opposition of misusing Waqf resources over the past 70 years.

title: RCB vs GT: IPL 2025 live broadcast: When and where to watch; all you need to know
content: RCB and GT will face off in an IPL 2025 match at M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru on April 2, with live streaming starting at 7:30 PM IST. RCB is unbeaten so far, while GT comes on the back of a big win against Mumbai Indians. Both teams are in strong form.

title: Watch: Chile Prez hails PM Modi as he can 'talk to every leader in world'
content: Chilean President Gabriel Boric hailed Prime Minister Narendra Modi's pivotal role in global diplomacy during his state visit to India. President Boric emphasized Chile's commitment to strengthening ties with India, coinciding with the 76th anniversary of diplomatic relations between the two nations.

title: Boy with 1580 SAT score rejected by all Ivy League schools; dad shares post
content: A Reddit user shared his son's heartbreak after being rejected by prestigious colleges despite exceptional academic achievements. The boy, valedictorian with a 1580 SAT score, only got accepted to UMass Amherst. The incident sparked a discussion on college admission pressures, self-worth, and the importance of resilience and parental support in facing rejection.

title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex opens over 200 points up; Nifty50 above 23,200
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, BSE Sensex and Nifty50, opened in green in trade on Wednesday. While BSE Sensex moved up over 200 points, Nifty50 went above 23,300.

title: Car flips 15 times, bodies thrown in the air: 3 dead in Karnataka crash
content: A fatal accident on NH-150A in Chitradurga district claimed three lives on Tuesday morning. The accident involved a car hitting the highway divider and rolling over 15 times. The deceased were Moula Abdul and his two sons. The accident left three other family members with serious injuries. The family was travelling from Bengaluru to Yadgir.

title: ‘Sikandar’ box office collection: Salman's film sees a major dip in earnings
content: Bollywood superstar Salman Khan's film 'Sikandar,' starring Rashmika Mandanna, opened to mixed reviews and underperformed at the box office. Despite the Eid holiday, early online leaks affected its performance, resulting in a total collection of Rs. 74.5 crore in three days. 'Sikandar' failed to surpass Vicky Kaushal's 'Chhaava' at the box office.

title: Jasprit Bumrah and Akash Deep's comebacks delayed
content: Jasprit Bumrah is still in recovery at the BCCI Centre of Excellence, gradually increasing his workload to prevent a stress fracture in his back. Both Bumrah and Akash Deep, who are nursing back injuries, aim to return to competitive cricket by mid-April, with medical teams treading cautiously.

title: Musk’s bet on Schimel falls short as Liberal wins Wisconsin Supreme Court race
content: Susan Crawford, a Dane County judge, secured a significant victory over Republican-backed Brad Schimel in a record-breaking Wisconsin Supreme Court election. This win, seen as a crucial triumph for Democrats, maintains the liberal majority on the state’s court and highlights the intensifying national political divisions. The race, marked by unprecedented spending, showcased high-profile endorsements and voter turnout.

title: Jharkhand train mishap: One of the dead loco pilots was set to retire today
content: Two loco pilots were killed and four others injured in a head-on collision between two goods trains in Sahibganj district early Tuesday. The accident, attributed to the negligence of the pilots, occurred on the NTPC-managed Lalmatiya-Farakka coal route. An investigation is underway, and restoration efforts are being coordinated with local and railway authorities.

title: Ratan Tata leaves over Rs 3cr for home & office staff
content: Ratan Tata, who passed away in October 2024, left nearly Rs 3.5 crore for his house helps and office staff, waived off their loans, and ensured his belongings benefited the underprivileged. He bequeathed substantial amounts to his long-time cook, butler, and driver, canceled loans, and directed funds for his executors and domestic servants.

title: Government working on 4-5 US tariff fallout scenarios for India
content: The Indian government is closely monitoring the US reciprocal tariffs, which are expected to impact exports and demand. Trade experts anticipate higher duties on Indian goods, including agricultural products, to be a strategic move by the US in bilateral talks. India plans to push forward with trade negotiations to counter the tariff impacts.

title: SFJ: US has identified another 'Indian agent' in Pannun plot
content: Sikhs For Justice claims a US court identified an Indian agent involved in a plot to kill chief Gurpatwant Singh Pannun. The agent allegedly paid $15,000 for the assassination. Nikhil Gupta, facing charges of murder-for-hire, was arrested and extradited to the US. Gupta is set for trial later this year.

title: J&K: Kathua search covers new areas after terrorist fire
content: Security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district engaged in a gunfight while pursuing Pakistani terrorists, following an earlier clash that resulted in casualties. Searches intensified in the Ramkote area with drones and sniffer dogs. Several villagers are suspected of aiding the infiltrators.

title: 'Most affected' Naxal districts down to just six from 12: Amit Shah
content: India has achieved significant progress in reducing Left-wing extremism, with the number of affected districts decreasing from 38 to 18 across seven states. Most-affected districts have halved, leading to substantial declines in LWE incidents and deaths, showing a successful government effort in combating Naxalism.

title: Ctrl C + Ctrl V: Story of eco surveys in Karnataka
content: Karnataka's economic surveys over three years have repeated content verbatim, particularly in sections about government schemes and urban development. Despite a change in administration, only the data tables were updated. The Directorate of Economics and Statistics claimed the responsibility lies with individual departments for the lack of updated analysis, leading to criticisms of their approach.

title: Should we start digging up 30,000 mosques: Dattatreya Hosabale
content: RSS general secretary Dattatreya Hosabale states the Sangh's opposition to reclaiming thousands of mosques allegedly built on demolished temples. He underscores the potential societal hostility and urgency of other priorities like eliminating untouchability. The Sangh emphasizes focusing on instilling values and cultural preservation rather than pursuing past disputes.

title: Parliament Live Updates: Waqf Discussion Today, India Bloc To Vote Against Bill
content: Parliament Live Updates: The Waqf Amendment Bill of 2024 aims to amend the Waqf Act, 1995, to redress the issues and challenges in regulating and managing Waqf properties.

title: India, Others Brace For Impact As Trump's Tariff "Liberation Day" Dawns
content: Donald Trump has labelled April 2 "Liberation Day", insisting that the levies will free the United States from its reliance on foreign goods. Trump appeared to substantially expand his tariff plans, insisting that "all countries" would be targeted.

title: Only One US President Served More Than 2 Terms. Here's Why
content: Only one person, Franklin Delano Roosevelt, has ever served more than two terms as president of the United States. This is for two reasons.

title: How Trump "Liberation Day" Tariffs May Impact India And The Silver Lining
content: US President Donald Trump will unleash his sweeping global tariffs today amid fears that equity markets could go on a whirlwind and force countries to take emergency measures. It will most likely result in an all-out trade war.

title: Days After Mega Delimitation Huddle, MK Stalin's Letter To PM Modi
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has sought a meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, days after the DMK leader hosted a meeting of top Opposition leaders to discuss their strategy against the proposed delimitation of parliamentary seats.

title: "Break Up Bangladesh...": Tripura Ex-Royal On "Extension Of China" Remark
content: Bangladesh leader Mohd Yunus' comments about the northeastern states - which he called "an extension of the Chinese economy" and which he seemed to urge Beijing to take over - have triggered fierce reactions, including one to "break up Bangladesh".

title: Cops Find Chopped 'Hand', Launch 5-Hour Murder Probe. It Was A Sex Doll
content: On a routine dog walk in Rostock, Germany, a passerby discovered what looked like a burnt human hand protruding from a plastic bag.

title: How Val Kilmer Got His Voice Back For His Last Scene In Top Gun: Maverick
content: When Val Kilmer played Iceman on screen one last time in Top Gun: Maverick, little did his fans know that they were seeing him on screen the last time

title: LSG Owner Sanjiv Goenka Catches Rishabh Pant, Recreates KL Rahul Scene
content: Rishabh Pant was involved in an intense chat with LSG owner Sanjiv Goenka after the team's defeat against Punjab Kings.

title: Haldiram Sells Stake To International Holding Company, Alpha Wave Global
content: Haldiram Snacks Food, the country's leading snack and food brand, on Monday confirmed selling its stake to two new investors -- IHC (International Holding Company) and Alpha Wave Global -- according to a release.

title: Zaheer Khan's Big Accusation At Lucknow Staff Over 'PBKS-Favouring Pitch'
content: With injuries limiting their fast-bowling options, LSG might have preferred a pitch that favoured spin or at least neutralized the Punjab Kings (PBKS) pace attack.

title: "Development At Cost Of Biodiversity": Dia Mirza Backs Hyderabad Students
content: Actor Dia Mirza has come out in support of the students protesting against the redevelopment of 400 acres of land adjacent to the Hyderabad Central University.

title: SpaceX Shares First-Ever View Of Earth's Poles From Space, Elon Musk Reacts
content: The crew is capturing breathtaking views of our planet's most remote regions on the SpaceX Crew Dragon Resilience.

title: A-List Guests, Exclusive Venues: Inside Bezos-Sanchez's Grand Wedding
content: The City of Venice said only 200 guests would be invited, a number easily accommodated without any disruption to the city, its residents and visitors.

title: Woman's Ghibli-Style Makeover Goes Wrong. She Gets A Third Hand
content: The internet has found its latest obsession: the Ghibli trend. Thanks to OpenAI's newest image-generation tool, social media users, including celebrities and politicians, are transforming their pictures into dreamy, Studio Ghibli-style animations.

title: 'Nokia': Shai Gilgeous-Alexander makes cameo in Drake music video
content: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander made a cameo in Drake's "Nokia" music video . he appeared at the 2:37 mark in the video with colorways of his new signature Converse sneaker around his neck . the Oklahoma City guard shares the same birthplace as Drake: Ontario, Canada .

title: NBA coaching carousel: What's next for the Grizzlies and Kings jobs?
content: the Memphis Grizzlies fired longtime coach Taylor Jenkins on friday . there are two open head coaching jobs with two weeks to go in the regular season . this year's coaching carousel looks at the pros and cons of each vacancy .

title: Our annual mock draft with 32 first-round trades: Deals for Kirk Cousins, Micah Parsons
content: the mock draft of trades is a chance to put together my most ridiculous and enjoyable column of the year . most mocks have no trades, because as hard as it is to predict where players will actually end up, it's downright impossible to project which teams will make moves up and down and impact the draft order . the vast majority of the first 32 picks aren't in the universe in which the no. 2 pick gets traded .

title: History will blame Nitish Kumar more than BJP: Prashant Kishor on Waqf bill
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: 'Unprovoked firing': Pak troops violate ceasefire, intrude into J&K's Poonch
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: 'UPA-era was only to put stamp, we conduct discussions': Amit Shah on Waqf Bill
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: Indian-American Jay Bhattacharya begins tenure as director of NIH
content: The most unique Hollywood star kids’ names 10 blockbuster movies of Vikram to revisit amidst 'Veera Dheera Sooran' success 10 inspiring quotes to start your day on the right note Stunning bird species in India that are worth travelling for Keerthy Suresh Radiates Timeless Elegance in a Mesmerising Saree ​Top Allari Naresh movies to watch​ 10 animals that live without oxygen deep below or frozen above Samantha Ruth Prabhu's breathtaking ethnic looks How to make South Indian Beetroot Dosa for breakfast

title: Police arrest prime accused in Pathar Pratima blast
content: The prime accused, Chandrakanta Banik, is the owner of the firecrackers manufacturing unit situated a few metres away from the house where the explosion took place late Monday night

title: CJI Sanjiv Khanna welcomes Irish SC judge Justice Gerard Hogan
content: Justice Gerard Hogan was with the Court of Appeals and was also the Advocate General for the European Court of Appeals, the CJI said

title: Law and order plays key role in overall development of State: Karnataka CM
content: Twenty-two personnel from the Karnataka State Intelligence and Anti-Naxal Force awarded CM’s medal for making the State ‘Naxal free’ in 2024

title: Indian Navy’s INS Tarkash intercepts, seizes 2,500 kg narcotics in western Indian Ocean
content: “On March 31, 2025, while on patrol, INS Tarkash received multiple inputs from Indian Navy P8I maritime patrol aircraft regarding suspicious vessels operating in the area believed to be involved in illicit activities, including narcotics trafficking,” the Defence Ministry said

title: Gujarat firecracker blast: Bodies of deceased taken to villages in Madhya Pradesh
content: “The deceased, which included five children, hailed from the two villages of Sandalpur and Hadia in Dewas and Harda districts of Madhya Pradesh,” officials said

title: Government loses ₹1,757 crore as BSNL fails to bill Reliance Jio for sharing infra: CAG
content: “BSNL failed to enforce the Master Service Agreement (MSA) with M/s. Reliance Jio Infocomm Ltd (RJIL) and did not bill for the additional technology used on BSNL’s shared passive infrastructure, resulting in loss of Rs 1,757.76 crore and penal interest thereon, between May 2014 to March 2024 to the government exchequer,” CAG said

title: Police arrest owner of firecracker godown where blast killed 21 persons in Gujarat’s Banaskantha district
content: “Deepak Mohnani was arrested by a team of Banaskantha police from neighbouring Sabarkantha district on April 1,” Inspector General of Border Range Chirag Koradia said.

title: Kuki bodies set up three pre-conditions ahead of April 5 talks in Delhi
content: Kuki-Zo and Meitei groups set pre-conditions ahead of the talks called by the Ministry of Home Affairs in New Delhi on April 5, 2025

title: Indian Army asks Pakistan to abide by 2021 ceasefire agreement after Poonch skirmish
content: The Indian Army reiterated its commitment to maintaining peace along the LoC and emphasized the importance of adhering to the agreement established in 2021

title: Two women Maoists killed in encounter in Madhya Pradesh's Mandla district
content: An SLR rifle, an ordinary rifle, wireless set and some items of daily use were recovered from the spot

title: T.N. CM Stalin seeks urgent meeting with PM Modi over concerns on proposed delimitation
content: “I have requested a meeting with you (Mr. Modi), alongside MPs from various parties, to present our memorandum on the concerns surrounding the proposed delimitation,” Mr. Stalin said

title: Ex-Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel one of the alleged 'beneficiaries' of Mahadev betting scam: CBI FIR
content: The CBI has re-registered the FIR of the Economic Offences Wing (EOW) of the Chhattisgarh police as its own case under the Indian Penal Code sections of 120-B (criminal conspiracy), cheating (420) and Chhattisgarh Gambling (Prohibition) Act

title: More precise weather forecasting system for fishery sector needed, says IMD DG Mrutyunjay Mohapatra
content: IMD has created a WhatsApp group connecting at least five villagers from each village directly with IMD and is ensuring deeper penetration of agrometeorological services, he says

title: Waqf (Amendment) Bill | Analysis and explainers from The Hindu
content: The amendment seeks to reform the 1995 Waqf Act by enhancing the Centre’s regulatory authority over waqf properties

title: Green future for whom?: Revisiting the marginalised lives of Challakere and Pavagada
content: While clean energy is inevitable for a sustainable future, what shouldn’t be ignored is the unequal distribution of burdens of climate action on the poor and marginalised of rural India, argues Bhargavi S. Rao, educator, researcher and former trustee at Environment Support Group

title: Why India needs to clean its air
content: India’s clean air future will be shaped not by dashboards but by people, partnerships, and purpose. Lasting solutions depend on those working on the ground: municipal officers, planners, engineers, and community leaders

title: Now, Vaiko demands ban on Mohanlal-starrer L2: Empuraan
content: Pointing to some controversial scenes depicted in the movie, the Rajya Sabha member says the movie had portrayed Mullaperiyar dam as unsafe

title: Among Ministries, Home Affairs ‘dropped’ most assurances made in Parliament
content: Dropped assurances in Parliament involved issues related to the Pulwama terror attack and the rewarding of policemen allegedly involved in fake encounters

title: Union Shipping Minister says Coastal Shipping Bill will unlock India’s maritime potential
content: Opposition members question the Bill’s impact on fishermen and the role of States in coastal shipping governance

title: BMTC achieves record 39.8% ticket revenue through UPI
content: On February 8, BMTC achieved a significant milestone as the digital payment (UPI) for tickets crossed ₹1 crore in a single day.

title: AIMPLB appeals to secular parties, MPs to oppose Waqf bill, vote against it
content: The AIMPLB president further said in his appeal that these amendments would lead to the abolition of Waqf by-user, removal of exemptions from the Law of Limitation, inclusion of non-Muslim members in Waqf boards and the Central Waqf Council, and the reduction of powers of Waqf tribunals

title: 10th class public examinations conclude peacefully
content: In a statement, Director of School Education V. Vijay Rama Raju said out of 6,24,742 students registered for the Social Studies examination across the State, 6,17,333 students appeared, while 7,409 were absent

title: Karnataka HC refuses to interfere with Bengaluru metro fare hike; says issue belong to domain of experts and not courts
content: The petitioners had contended that fare structure is irrational, as it does not adhere to the station-to-station model, and violates Section 33 of Metro Rail (Operation and Maintenance), Act, 2002.

title: Reduced toll charges between Hyderabad and Vijayawada
content: The revised toll charges, as per the authority, were reduced by ₹15 for a one-way ride and ₹30 for a two-way ride for a light motor vehicle or a four-wheeler at Pantangi toll plaza

title: Panel to ensure smooth implementation of free education for poor children in private schools
content: A State-level committee will determine ‘per-child’ expenditure to be met by the government for students admitted to private schools under the Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education Act, 2009.

title: TMC leaders question party’s ‘silence’ on SFI’s protests against Mamata at Oxford
content: While some Trinamool leaders have alleged a lack of initiative by party workers and youth members to protest against the SFI’s disruption at Oxford, party MP Sougata Roy said such incidents do not warrant a ‘hue and cry’

title: INSV Tarini reaches Cape Town on final stopover of global circumnavigation
content: The sailing vessel, crewed by two women naval officers, reaches its final international port of call in South Africa during the Navika Sagar Parikrama II circumnavigation.

title: Babulal Marandi demands action against liquor agencies in Jharkhand
content: Former CM alleges that liquor agencies are responsible for revenue loss of over ₹25 crore to the State exchequer as it did not deposit the amount of sales in the shop with Jharkhand State Beverages Corporation Limited (JSBCL)

title: In a first, women in J&K get free bus service
content: J&K CM flags off new travel initiative for women; the free service is limited to smart city e-buses and J&K Road Transport Corporation (JKRTC) buses across the Union Territory

title: Telangana HC to hear two PIL pleas questioning UoH’s Kancha Gachibowli land allotment to TGIIC
content: The counsel informed the Bench that the government’s actions were disturbing the eco-system resulting in harm to the flora and fauna in Kancha Gachibowli

title: Kumbakonam betel leaves, a blend of tradition and tenderness
content: The Kumbakonam betel leaf, which is renowned for its remarkable tenderness (Kozhundhu Vettrilai), owing to its early harvest, has secured the Geographical Indication (GI) tag

title: Kerala High Court calls for strict action on reckless driving
content: State govt. files action-taken report following an accident in which a woman was killed at Menaka reportedly due to reckless driving of buses

title: Traitor jibe at Shinde: Police issue third summons to Kamra, ask him to appear on April 5
content: Kunal Kamra has been asked to appear before officials of the Khar Police Station in suburban Mumbai where the first FIR against him was registered last month, police said.

title: Possible terror attack thwarted with one arrest, hand grenade seized: Punjab Police
content: Meanwhile, the CI team of Ferozepur busted a cross-border drug smuggling racket with the arrest of a smuggler and seized 3.50 kilogram of heroin from his possession, officials said.

title: India, China should realise cooperative ‘pas de deux’ of dragon and elephant, says Xi Jinping on 75th anniversary of bilateral ties
content: Mr. Xi termed India and China “ancient civilisations, major developing countries and important members of the Global South”, and noted that both countries are at a critical stage in their respective modernisation drive.

title: Centre has no intention of using new Bill to meddle with cooperatives: Minister in Rajya Sabha
content: The Minister said the Tribhuvan Sahkari University Bill is part of several new initiatives by the Ministry

title: Maharashtra Cabinet approves e-bike taxis, mineral foundation in Gadchiroli district
content: State Transport Minister Pratap Sarnaik said the e-bike policy was the ‘first step’ towards a pollution-free Maharashtra, and could generate 10,000 jobs in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region and 20,000 jobs across Maharashtra

title: Allies support Waqf Bill, JD(U) urges government to not implement with retrospective effect
content: TDP, while backing the Bill, is silent on the finer details of its position; LJP (Ram Vilas) with just five MPs attacked the Opposition for running a ‘misleading narrative’

title: Urban Policy Commission’s recommendation gives a fillip to ‘City of Literature’ initiatives
content: The Commission’s report, submitted to Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan on Sunday (March 30), comes close on the heels of the UNESCO selecting Kozhikode as one of its creative cities and conferring it the tag of ‘City of Literature’

title: GST gross collections for 2024-2025 touch ₹44,825 crore
content: The net GST collections in March 2025 reached ₹3,116 crore, marking the highest amount collected in the past 11 months and the second highest in the year, said Chief Commissioner of Tax Babu A.

title: Helping children with autism navigate puberty and sexual awareness
content: Experts emphasise the need for continuous support from parents and teachers to help adolescents on the autism spectrum understand and adjust to puberty changes

title: Centre rejects Opposition charge that off-shore mining was affecting fishermen community
content: The Minister made the comment in the Lok Sabha while replying to a Calling Attention Motion, moved by senior Congress member K. C. Venugopal on the “hardships faced by the fishermen community”

title: Law enforcement should be aware of changes in country: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: At the D.P. Kohli Memorial Lecture, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw told law enforcement agencies that they needed to collaborate more with academia, startups, and industry

title: Bombay High Court denies bail to school bus driver for sexually assaulting a minor
content: Driver allegedly stopped bus, sexually assaulted eight-year-old girl; offence is “very serious, grave and heinous,” says judge, denying bail despite accused completing a third of the maximum sentence possible

title: Opposition hail SC order on demolitions in U.P., push for strict regulations
content: Describing PDA’s actions as ‘illegal’ and ‘targeting certain people’, the opposition has stressed the importance of delivering justice.

title: Tejashwi challenges Amit Shah to ‘face-to-face talk’ with facts
content: The RJD leader was reacting to allegations levelled by the Union Home Minister during the latter’s visit to Gopalganj on Sunday (March 30, 2025); Shah had slammed RJD and party supremo Lalu Prasad over ‘jungle raj’ in Bihar

title: CPI(M) party congress in Madurai will be politically significant, says veteran journalist N. Ram
content: Draft political resolution, which notes that the Hindutva-corporate nexus displays neo-fascist characteristics, is a very important and new observation, N. Ram says

title: Delhi HC faults Centre for not following due process in OCI card holder blacklisting case
content: Govt. says the petitioner was denied entry because he had been blacklisted by security agencies on account of his involvement in missionary activities in Nagaland and other northeastern States without obtaining special permission from the competent authority

title: Ranya’s mother moves Karnataka High Court for preserving CCTV camera footage of her daughter at airport
content: Justice M. Nagaprasanna, before whom the petition came up for hearing, has adjourned further hearing on the petition till Wednesday

title: ‘Need of the hour’ is to raise OBC creamy layer income limit, House panel tells government
content: Panel also noted that DoPT portal on quota implementation is internal, urges govt. to publish data in annual reports, websites for transparency

title: Crackdown on wheeling offences: 398 cases booked in March in Bengaluru
content: Officials said that 397 vehicles were seized, and 324 individuals were arrested during the drive. Among those caught, 82 were minors, prompting authorities to take action against 68 guardians for negligence.

title: Tamil Nadu working on a blueprint to protect the ‘feathered foresters’ that restore ecology
content: The State has planned to establish a Centre of Excellence to conserve the Great Hornbill, the Malabar Pied Hornbill, the Indian Grey Hornbill, and the Malabar Grey Hornbill. The Forest Department has identified key areas for conservation: Anamalai Tiger Reserve, Athikkadavu-Pilloor-Bhavanisagar Valley, and the drier forests like Sathyamangalam

title: When Turkey’s Honorary Consul-General was disqualified as MLA in Tamil Nadu
content: In the 1980 Tamil Nadu Assembly election, Congress leader K.S. Haja Shereff won from Triplicane. The next year, Governor Sadiq Ali announced that Shereff was to be disqualified because of his appointment as Turkey’s Honorary Consul-General in Madras. Shereff moved the Madras High Court, which upheld his disqualification

title: India, Chile to start talks for comprehensive trade pact: PM
content: World’s biggest copper producer CODELCO signs deal with Hindustan Copper Ltd that could reduce Chile’s dependence on Chinese market; India, Chile agree to deepen cooperation on Antarctica exploration

title: Amid protests against flyover, Hemant Soren takes part in Sarhul festival
content: Tribals continue protests with black flags and slogans directed at the Chief Minister; BJP accuses Soren of ignoring the voice of the tribal society

title: Farmers stage protest seeking release of water into NLBC to save standing crops
content: A large number of farmers participate in the protest outside the KBJNL Chief Engineer’s office in Bheemarayanagudi

title: 2,988 drugs were declared ‘substandard’ in West Bengal in 2024
content: 1,06,150 drug samples were tested in the past one year, and prosecution launched against 604 enterprises for the manufacture, sale and distribution of spurious drugs, Minister of State for Health Anupriya Patel said in the Rajya Sabha

title: Parents can choose to cancel gift deeds executed in favour of select children: Madras High Court
content: A Division Bench says even if senior citizens had settled multiple properties in favour of different children, they could choose to cancel only select deeds

title: APMC should oversee strict adherence to medical ethics, says Minister Satya Kumar
content: Swearing-in ceremony of six nominated members of the interim A.P. Medical Council held at Dr. NTR University of Health Science

title: Vizhinjam handles 240 ships, 4.9 lakh TEU cargo in first fiscal
content: The seaport sets another record by handling over 1 lakh containers in a single month by managing 1.08 lakh TEUs from 51 vessels in March

title: SCR Vijayawada division achieves its highest freight loading, revenue during FY 2024-25
content: The gross revenue of the division for FY 2024-25 was ₹5,836.61 crore, the highest-ever in the history of Vijayawada division, say SCR officials

title: Pharmacy intern suicide: She will die if shifted to another hospital, say doctors
content: The 23-year-old intern at KIMS-Bollineni hospital remains on ventilator support as doctors deem her condition too critical for transfer

title: NMC tax collections amount to ₹77.76 crore this fiscal
content: The civic body collected an additional ₹11.38 crore in financial year 2024-25 when compared to total ₹66.38 crore in last fiscal

title: Police probe murder conspiracy against MLC R. Rajendra after leaked audio surfaces in Karnataka
content: Rajendra Rajanna lodged a formal complaint with the Tumakuru Superintendent of Police after receiving a pen drive containing the audio file
